Hey, Idk if you've heard, but BitBlockBoom has been disqualified from the Bitcoin Games since they weren't a local grassroots meetup. Since we came in 2nd, the coin is coming to us. In the spirit of the games, we're going to be putting together a twitter competition BitCombine, to distribute half of the coin amongst the other finalists. We're still working on the specifics but I wanted to update y'all and make sure these are the best accounts to communicate through
Ill share more details as I have them

They published a correction: this tweet clarifies that while all these inscriptions are produced by Unisat.io using Unisats single private key, they are actually owned by various Unisat users.

a substack post going around at the moment claims that a single entity owns 64% of all inscriptions created since early March, paying an eye-watering 1056 BTC for the privilege its not true. https://block21m.substack.com/p/most-bitcoin-inscriptions-belong-d6d

Its been a wild month, everyone. Topics for Socratic Seminar #18, hot off the press. See you tomorrow night at NCR! https://atlantabitdevs.org/2023/05/30/bitcoin-socratic-seminar-18/

Bitcoin Socratic Seminar 18 - Atlanta BitDevs: Its almost time for Bitcoin Socratic Seminar 18! What is a Socratic Seminar? Inspired by other BitDevs meetups around the US, our Socratic Seminar events are formatted to foster debate, information sharing and lively discussion. Discussion topics are provided ahead of the event The event moderator(s) leads the audience through the topics Raise your hand to‚Ä¶ Continue reading Bitcoin Socratic Seminar 18

Parking Instructions for NCR - Atlanta BitDevs. Here are instructions for getting to NCR for Atlanta BitDevs Socratic Seminars. Rideshare or Public Transit If you are taking rideshare or public transit, then you can use the main building address to navigate there. Come to the Socratic Seminar tomorrow night and meet ATL BitDevs
Ive only orangepilled one business around here. Do you know of any businesses in ATL that accept bitcoin besides Ginos barber shop??
I helped Ginos set up their Lightning node.

My contributions so far to the community are a DIY hww built from an esp32 that prints burner wallets en masse on thermal paper‚Ä¶ and a vending machine controller that runs on Strike, Bitcoin Core and Liquid Core.
Btcpayserver invoices make these fairly easy.
Anyways. I am probably overly chatty for a newbie. Hope you all have a good night. Thanks for the warm welcome
Sorry to miss Wed mtg @ NCR. I feel like Im going through pleb withdrawal after overdosing when we were in MIA!

Welcome Will! Thanks for the input. Looking forward to meeting you tonight and hearing all about the work you've done in the past. We could use some of this innovation to help onboard more businesses in ATL!!
